sen.j: 三宅御土居（みやけおどい）は島根県益田市三宅町にあった城。
sen.e: Miyake odoi was a castle that existed in Miyake-Cho, Masuda City, Shimane Prefecture.
Miyake odoi was a castle that existed in Miyake-Cho, Masuda City, Shimane Prefecture.
Miyake odoi was a castle that existed in Miyake-Cho, Masuda City, Shimane Prefecture.

sen.j: 三宅御土居は、益田兼見により、室町時代の応永年間（1368〜75）年に築かれたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Miyake odoi was built between 1368 and 1375 by Kaneharu MIYAKE.
Miyake odoi was allegedly built between 1368 and 1375 by Kaneharu MIYAKE.
sen.cmt: changed "It is said" to "allegedly" and fixed grammar accordingly
sen.e: Miyake odoi was allegedly built between 1368 and 1375 by Kaneharu MIYAKE.

sen.j: 発掘調査が進められており、現在井戸などが復元されている。
sen.e: Excavation and research are under way, and various items including a well have been restored.
Excavation and research are under way, and various items including a well have been restored.
Excavation and research are under way, and various items including a well have been restored.

sen.j: 平成16年（2004年）、 七尾城 (石見国)（益田城）とともに「益田氏城館跡」として国の史跡となった。
sen.e: In 2004, Miyake odoi was designated as historic site together with Nanao-jo Castle (Iwami Province) (Masuda Castle) under the name 'Ruins of Masuda clan Castles.'
In 2004, Miyake odoi was designated as a historic site together with Nanao-jo Castle (Iwami Province) (Masuda Castle) under the name 'Ruins of Masuda clan Castles.'
In 2004, Miyake odoi was designated as a historic site together with Nanao-jo Castle (Iwami Province) (Masuda Castle) under the name 'Ruins of Masuda clan Castles.'
